ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
1 = Absent; 2 = Much less than average; 3 = Less than average; 4 = Average; 5 = More than average
1 = Very Poor; 2 = Poor; 3 = Fair; 4 = Fair to Good; 5 = Good

ElementDescription: General warmth vs. coldness of R's affect
Notes: 1 = Very warm; 2 = Warm; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Cold; 5 = Very cold
1 = Very slow - long pauses in R's speech; 2 = Slow - rate slower than normal; 3 = Average; 4 = Slightly pressured speech; 5 = Definitely pressured speech
1 = Motor behavior definitely odd; 3 = Motor behavior moderately odd; 5 = Motor behavior slightly odd; 7 = No evidence of odd motor behavior

ElementDescription: Social - appropriateness of R's social behavior
Notes: 1 = Social behavior definitely odd; 3 = Social behavior moderately odd; 5 = Social behavior slightly odd; 7 = No evidence of social oddness

ElementDescription: Dress - appropriateness of dress, grooming, cleanliness
Notes: 1 = Very Poor; 2 = Poor; 3 = Fair; 4 = Fair to Good; 5 = Good

ElementDescription: Who else was present during the interview? (select all that apply)
Notes: 1 = No one; 2 = Other adults; 3 = Child(ren); 4 = Adults and child(ren) under 18
1 = Not at all neat and clean; 3 = Not very neat and clean; 5 = Somewhat neat and clean; 7 = Very neat and clean

ElementDescription: How well-maintained was the interior of the dwelling?
Notes: 1 = Very poorly; 2 = Poorly; 3 = Mixed; 4 = Quite well; 5 = Very well; 6 = Did not see
